se.jguru.nazgul.core.algorithms.event.api

Interface EventConsumerWrapper<T>

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    EventProducer<T>, EventPublisher<E,T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEventProducer

    public interface EventConsumerWrapper<T>
    Specification for how to add, remove and list event consumers of a certain type.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String addConsumer(T consumer)
      Adds the provided listener to this EventProducer provided that the listener was not already added.
      T getConsumer(String consumerID)
      Acquires the registered EventConsumer with the provided consumerID.
      List<String> getConsumerIDs() 
      boolean removeConsumer(String consumerID)
      Removes the EventConsumer with the given consumerID from this EventProducer.

    • Method Detail

      • addConsumer

        String addConsumer(T consumer)
        Adds the provided listener to this EventProducer provided that the listener was not already added. Silently ignores adding an already added EventConsumer instance.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The EventConsumer instance to add.
        Returns:
        The consumerID of the registered consumer.

      • getConsumerIDs

        List<String> getConsumerIDs()
                     throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns:
        a non-null List containing unique identifiers for all known/added EventConsumers.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if this EventProducer cannot not provide the IDs of all known EventConsumers.

      • removeConsumer

        boolean removeConsumer(String consumerID)
        Removes the EventConsumer with the given consumerID from this EventProducer.
        Parameters:
        consumerID - The unique identifier of the EventConsumer to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the EventConsumer with the given ID was properly removed, and false otherwise.

      • getConsumer

        T getConsumer(String consumerID)
        Acquires the registered EventConsumer with the provided consumerID.
        Parameters:
        consumerID - The unique identifier for the EventConsumer to retrieve
        Returns:
        the EventConsumer with the given consumerID or null if none exists.
